About.title: About
About.content1-1: Dr Aqeel Farooque is a highly qualified and experienced Pediatric Endocrinologist who is passionate about helping children with endocrine-related health issues. He is currently the head of the Diabetes & Endocrinology Unit at Al Qassimi Women’s & Children’s Hospital, Sharjah. This is a tertiary referral center providing care for children of the Northern Emirates, with complex endocrine-related health issues.
About.content1-2: He also serves Adjunct Clinical Professor at the College of Medicine, University of Sharjah, and is passionate about teaching medical students and post-graduate students in the MSc in Diabetes Management course.
About.content2-1: His journey in medicine began with an MBBS degree from Bangalore, India. Later he pursued pediatrics and pediatric endocrinology training in the United Kingdom and worked as a consultant pediatric endocrinologist in both the UK and Saudi Arabia before moving to the UAE in 2017.
About.content2-2: He is affiliated with several national and international pediatric endocrinology societies, including DPEC, EPEC, ASPED, BSPED and ESPE, which reflects his dedication to staying up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in the field.
About.content2-3: He is fluent in three languages, including English, Arabic, and Urdu, which allows him to effectively communicate with a diverse range of patients and families from diverse backgrounds.

HomeMain.exceptional: Exceptional care in endocrinology for children and adolescents

HomeMethod.Title: Mothodology
HomeMethod.Consultations-Description: Dr Aqeel will review the child's medical history, perform a physical exam, and order any necessary lab tests or imaging studies.
HomeMethod.Testing-Description: These tests may include blood tests, imaging studies (such as X-rays, Ultrasound, MRI, etc.), and hormone stimulation tests.
HomeMethod.Treatment-Description: Once a diagnosis has been made, Dr Aqeel will work with the child and their family to develop a treatment plan. Treatment may include medications, hormone replacement therapy, lifestyle changes, or surgery in some cases.
HomeMethod.Hollistic-Description: He makes an extra effort to provide tailored treatment plans to meet the unique needs of each child.

BlogData.Title: Which Growth Hormone is best for my child’s growth?
BlogData.CopyTitle: Copy of Which Growth Hormone is best for my child’s growth?
BlogData.shortDes: If your pediatric endocrinologist feels that your child needs growth hormone injections to achieve optimal height, they may have already suggested a few different options of growth hormone pens or...
BlogData.fullDesc1: If your pediatric endocrinologist feels that your child needs growth hormone injections to achieve optimal height, they may have already suggested a few different options of growth hormone pens or devices. And perhaps, you maybe reading this to help decide “the best” growth hormone. The one that has the maximum benefit and least side effect of all makes in the market.
BlogData.fullDesc2: Look no further, because I have the answer you …. its ALL THE SAME! All the growth hormone use recombinant DNA (rDNA) technology, a well tried, tested and widely used method to produce many medicines from hormones to antibiotics and blood products. They all undergo a purification and testing process to make sure they are well within WHO standards.
BlogData.fullDesc3: The daily growth hormone is the traditional one, that has been tested over the past few decades to be very safe when used according to the doctor’s recommendations for dosage and storage.
BlogData.fullDesc4: Over the last year, we now have access to newer weekly growth hormones, that use tried and tested biotechnologies to make its effect last a week.
BlogData.fullDesc5: So here is a quick answer: the best growth hormone for you and your child is the one you can afford throughout the duration of the treatment (generally many years), the one you can remember to give everyday, and the one that is easily available.

ServicesData.title: Services
ServicesData.description: His clinical expertise lies in pediatric diabetes & endocrinology, and he provides consultations for a wide range of endocrine-related health problems in children, including type 1, 2, and rare types of diabetes, as well as issues related to growth, puberty, thyroid, adrenal, pituitary, sex development, calcium, and metabolic bone disorders. He also works with children who have genetic abnormalities that may cause endocrine problems.
ServicesData.Diabetes Management-Description: Dr Aqeel provides care for Type 1, Type 2, and genetically-induced diabetes. He uses advanced technologies such as insulin pumps and continuous glucose monitors to enhance patients’ lives.
ServicesData.Growth Disorders-Description: Diagnosis and treatment of growth disorders, including short stature. He will recommend appropriate tests and treatment options, including growth hormone replacement therapy if necessary.
ServicesData.Puberty Problems-Description: He handles early, delayed, and puberty-like disorders with sensitivity and years of experience.
ServicesData.Tricky Thyroid-Description: Dr Aqeel treats conditions such as congenital and acquired hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism, and goiter, among others.
ServicesData.Vitamin D, Calcium, and Bones-Descriptio: He has experience in caring for children with vitamin D, calcium, parathyroid gland, and skeletal system disorders like rickets, bowed legs, easy fractures and soft bones
ServicesData.Adrenals and Sex Development-Description: Dr Aqeel manages steroid, adrenal, and sex hormone imbalances that affect children’s general health or cause ambiguity in their sex.
ServicesData.Complex Genetic-Endocrine Conditions-Des: He has experience in diagnosing and managing complex endocrine disorders related to genetic conditions that affect different organ systems.
ServicesData.Obesity-Description: Dr Aqeel provides compassionate and empathetic care for children struggling with weight issues. He will offer practical advice and potential medical treatments with realistic expectations are discussed.
ServicesData.Consultations-Description: Dr Aqeel will review the child’s medical history, perform a physical exam, and order any necessary lab tests or imaging studies.
ServicesData.Testing-Description: These tests may include blood tests, imaging studies (such as X-rays, Ultrasound, MRI, etc.), and hormone stimulation tests.
ServicesData.Treatment-Description: Once a diagnosis has been made, Dr Aqeel will work with the child and their family to develop a treatment plan. Treatment may include medications, hormone replacement therapy, lifestyle changes, or surgery in some cases.
ServicesData.Holistic Support-Description: Dr Aqeel will review the child’s medical history, perform a physical exam, and order any necessary lab tests or imaging studies.

FAQsPage.title: FAQs
FAQsPage.question1: How can I schedule an appointment with you?
FAQsPage.answer1: As Dr Aqeel currently works in Al Qassmi Women’s & Children’s Hospital, kindly click on this link for further information on how to book an appointment:
FAQsPage.question2: Do I need a referral from my child's primary care physician to see a pediatric endocrinologist?
FAQsPage.answer2: As Dr Aqeel currently works in Al Qassmi Women’s & Children’s Hospital, kindly click on this link for further information on how to book an appointment:
FAQsPage.answer3: Yes, we are currently accepting new patients. We strive to provide comprehensive care to all children in need of pediatric endocrinology services in Dubai and the Northern Emirates.
FAQsPage.question4: Is there a waiting period for appointments?
FAQsPage.answer4: We make every effort to minimize waiting times for our patients. While we strive to accommodate urgent cases promptly, certain non-urgent appointments may have a short waiting period. Our scheduling team will work closely with you to find the earliest available appointment that suits your needs.
FAQsPage.question5: Can I request a telemedicine appointment?
FAQsPage.answer5: Yes, we offer telemedicine appointments for certain conditions and follow-up visits. This option allows you to consult with our pediatric endocrinologist remotely, providing convenience and accessibility while ensuring quality care. Not all conditions may be suitable for telemedicine, so please consult with our team to determine eligibility.
FAQsPage.question6: What languages are spoken at your clinic?
FAQsPage.answer6: At our clinic, we prioritize effective communication. Our staff is proficient in English, Arabic and Urdu. However, we will try to ensure that language is not a barrier to understanding and providing excellent care for our patients and their families.
